ALL OTHER DISTRICT BUILDINGS WILL REMAIN CLOSED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

a.aria-label: School Closure Counseling Support Plan file group.

span.p: Our primary goal is to make sure our students' needs are met and that they feel safe. During this time, the counseling staff of Medina Central School District will be available for crisis calls/emergency situations daily between the hours of 11 a.m. and 1 P.m. If you have an emergency situation, please call emergency services at 9-1-1.

a.title: Go to comments for School Closure Counseling Support Plan

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Coping Support in a Time of Unease

a.aria-label: Coping Support in a Time of Unease file group.
a.span: Coping Support in a Time of Unease

span.p: The Orleans County Office of Mental Health has provided this tip sheet (attached) as guidance for all local families to help deal with stress and anxiety during this difficut time.
The National Association of School Psychologists have published resources to help children cope with changes resulting from COVID-19. They can be found here.

a.aria-label: Downnload COVID Coping Tips docx.docx file.

a.title: Go to comments for Coping Support in a Time of Unease

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.strong: We understand that this is an unusual and difficult time for our entire community. The work that has been shared by teachers is expected to be completed as assigned. Should you require assistance or clarification, please do not hesitate to reach out directly to your child's teacher for support. If you need printed materials please contact the District Office (585)798-2700.

a.aria-label: From the Oak Orchard Library file group.

strong.em: *New* Mrs. Debottis has posted some new links on her webpage.

br.span: We want to ensure that students keep reading while at home! We are starting a

where students read a book out loud to a pet, parent, or sibling. Reading out loud provides students with a boost in self-confidence as well as builds comprehension and allows them to make connections. Please take a picture of students reading to their pets, parents, or siblings and send them to
. We will be creating a collage of your pictures and adding it to our Oak Orchard Library website.

p.span: 4/16/20 - Also attached is a Book Scavenger Hunt Activity!

a.aria-label: From the High School Library file group.

span.p: MHS Library Remote Learning Resources- https://www.medinacsd.org/Page/1127
span.div: Click here to access many helpful remote learning resources for grades 8-12, including many free book resources (ebooks and audiobooks), online learning programs, library research databases, citation assistance, educational videos, fun educational sites, and more! This will be updated on a weekly basis.

While you are working from home, you may run into questions about research, using databases, accessing online information, citing your sources, and more. Or you may just need a good book recommendation! If you have questions, you can click on the "Ask the Librarian" button on the library webpage. It will send your question to Mrs. O'Toole and she will respond to your request.
